Posts.Content: Thanks Sascha Rose and Sarah. Definte food for thought - feeling calmer now. Elaine x
Posts.Title: Anyone had to choose whether or not to have Chemo?? Confused

Posts.Content: Hi This thread was here mid August when I was waiting for the post op mtg. and I have re-read a few times as v.helpful. I was told I would have rads plus drugs for 5 yrs as margins and nodes clear. Was relieved at the time and had treatment plan. I asked the consultant - do I need chemo and he said no. The only prob I have had is infection from lumpectomy plus chronic acid reflux.. Had appt  (Mon) with onc re rads (she was on holiday when they met to discuss the treatment plan post op) but she said my tumor was grade 2 and she wanted me to consider chemo. I am 56. She said it would improve outcome by 3.5% over the next 10 yrs. To be honest I found it hard to take it all in as itwas unexpected but agreed to chemo as realised I was emotional and thought I should try to think practically. I have been upset and anxious since. She initially came in calling me by the wrong name and had the wrong notes and when finished she didn't say good bye but left the room - I heard her say to the nurse in the corridor - tell her she can go home. I have cried a few times since finding out re the BC and this was one of them.  I am trying to separate how I felt from the need to make a good decision. She was OK overall and it was a busy clinic but she was a bit brusque.  I said the consultant surgeon had said chemo not needed but she said he is only a surgeon. I understand she is the onc and therefore an expert. Had to see BCN today to check the lump wound and the consultant surgeon was there - he said it is my choice and I should have another discussion with the onc. before I decide. I think he believes it is not needed.  They will monitor me over the next few years. Surely they are part of the same team? I now have to see onc Fri and  need to ask her some questions. Any suggestions welcome. Now more confused than ever... Thanks Elaine x
Posts.Title: Anyone had to choose whether or not to have Chemo?? Confused

Posts.Content: Thanks so much for your replies. I think if the odds were 5% it would be clearer cut. I will also ask whether the stats are based on figures since the newer generation drugs have been used. One of the best pieces of advice I was given here was - don't google and I have resisted. It feels like a big decision right now and I think you are right I need to feel I have made the right one for me - what ever that is. Thanks for info re the oncotype test - I wll ask re this.   Elaine x
Posts.Title: Anyone had to choose whether or not to have Chemo?? Confused

Posts.Content: Hi Jenny I had a lumpectomy (Aug 2012) but like you I had an infection and it is still a bit lumpy though getting less so as time goes on. Just finished chemo 5 so that may be affecting healing. The surgeon seems pleased with it after looking and feeling it and thinks it will settle down. I have just ordered some rosehip oil. I havn't put much on it as it felt tender up to recently and thought it best to leave well alone. I am due to start radiotherapy in Feb so will be moisturising as recommended. Have you asked the nurse, oncologist or surgeon to look at it? In meantime you could try ringing the helpline here or breast cancer care or your breast care nurse? I have found the anxiety almost as bad and at times worse than anything so don't suffer in silence. Hope you can get some re-assurance soon x
Posts.Title: my scar

Posts.Content: Hi Caryn I didn't have full node clearance (just few taken) but I leaked for a few weeks. I didn't have a drain as only had lumpectomy (was like a quadrectomy) and the wound is/was a bout 3-4 inches. The BCN  wasn't worried and squeezed it to get liquid out - that meant having a towel to catch it.. She encouraged me to squeeze it out as well especially in the shower. She said 'Better out than in'. I dried it carefully and put sterile dressings on but had to keep changing - found that large non sticky ones kept in place with sleep bra worked. BCN may give you some or you can buy them in Superdrug etc. The glue on the sticky ones ripped my skin. I did end up having antibiotics which helped me and the last leak I had after taking them was a bit gooey (sorry if you are eating your tea!) but that was because |I had had an infection which is not the case with you. It did get me down at the time and I felt a bit insecure going out.  It has dried up now but it did take 3-4 weeks for me. Yours may take much less so don't despair it will stop eventually. If you are worried ring and go in to get it checked out regularly. It can be worrying dealing with it on your own so reassurance does help. This really hepled me - the BCN being really accessible.  Not sure if any of this helps - please ask more if you need to   Elaine x
Posts.Title: burst seroma after full axillary node clearance

Posts.Content: Hi Steroids plus anxiety affected my sleep. I tried Nytol which helped - you can buy it over the counter. Worth trying though you might want to check with your nurse that it is OK first? Glad you eventually dropped off Best wishes X
Posts.Title: Can't sleep.

Posts.Content: Hi Annabel My heart goes out to you. I think the advice to talk to the helpline or BCN Is a good one. Waiting to see the onc is excruciating. I hope it goes well tomorrow. Will you have someone with you? I have found this helps. At the start of all this I got my diagnosis on my own and it was worse than when I had someone with me. They can also hear some ofthe things I didn't. Big hug to you and hope tomorrow is ok Elaine x
Posts.Title: really scared

Posts.Content: HI If you mean the Dexa bone scan which tests for bone density I had one last week and was told results would take 4 weeks. Not sure if it is the same in all areas. Not sure about other scans though the ct scan I had last year took 2 weeks for the results. Elaine x
Posts.Title: how long for bone scan results

Posts.Content: Hiya Just wanted to add my good wishes. I remember the day I had my lump removed. The advice above is good - try to rest your mind and body. When I got home I watched a lot of undemanding TV. Think I was becoming an antiques expert. In the hosp after the op my BCN came to see me and bought me an open front vest/ bra - not sure if that is usual. I found the £6 ones from Asda were good. Support from everyone here really helped. Thinking of you today - hope it goes well X
Posts.Title: Op day at last...

Posts.Content: Hi Both   Just wanted to wish you both good luck. I am also going in to hospt  next Thurs with op on Fri. Like you I am nervous. Will have node removed. Also still wrestling with decision re what op to have. Thinking of you both and hoping that all goes well   x
Posts.Title: MX tomorrow and lymph node clearance....

Posts.Content: Hi Janice Just wanted to say thank you so much for posting your news.  It really helps. I was diagnosed a short while ago and like many of us at that stage feared the worse. It continues to gi ve hope to me to read how others are coping/struggling and also moving forward.   Someone said it is like a hurdle race and my next  one is radiotherapy/hormones. I am trying to get over each one at a time so other womens' experiences are really important and do help.  Glad you had a holiday and enjoyed the festival. Trying to thnk of a treat for myself after the radiotherapy and hope they will be finished before Christmas.  Elaine x
Posts.Title: Living again

Posts.Content: Hi Julie In my case the radiotherapy starts about mid Oct. Interesting to hear your experience of it. I was told the hspt would write to me soon.  It was originally 15 sessions (40 mile round trip) but I need extra to target the chest wall so not 100% sure how many extra. I was so 'rabbit in the headlights' when the consutant went through everything that was one question I didn't ask. I am going to go with the flow and take some time - not easy for me.  I haven't made my mind up re work - I have a note to end of 1st week Sept . Still sore from the op and wound healing,  very tired and wondering re the emotional side of getting back. I only had the day of the funeral off when my mum died a few years back and I found this hard so weighing it all up. My instinct is to take it easy and as you say 'be kind' to myself. Elaine x
Posts.Title: Living again

Posts.Content: Hi Jackie I remember this day so vividly over 2 years ago. It was excruciating waiting until the apt in the afternoon. Once you know what you are dealing with a treatment plan will hopefully mean you will feel less stressed. Yes, there may be more questions and anxiety but I found not knowing worse. I came out feeling different from when I went in. Me and my partner went to the pub! Lots of us here will empathise with what you are going through today. I hope it goes OK. Thinking of you. Take care of yourself X
Posts.Title: Nevous

Posts.Content: Hi It does seem neverending. I am not someone who ever went to hspt much and this has dominated the last 4 months and will do for ages ( am only at chemo no.3 and then rad/drugs). I have never felt so vulnerable.  I was trying to get my life together just before  BC and had seen a solicitor to see about divorce. Now I have less energy and as before I have 3 children to consider (15,18 and 24) middle one just gone to university and eldest lives away. I am more than ever convincd I need to move on from my husband (it's a long story) but timing has been a real issue for me and I haven't worked this one out 100% yet. Husband has never been very kind to me and has a tendency to try to be controlling. I thought he might be better in all humanity to help me but he is strugging becuase his default position is to feel sorry for himself.  I have supported him financially for the last 15 years through a failed business and re-training twice. I am trying to conserve energy to get through this and hopefully heal and get better and have a happer future. Harder to see some days than ever.  So don;t worry about sharing and being boring Sascha. I am glad you can share and discuss and thank all those who do this.  We are all on a hard road no matter what is going on in the bigger picture of our lives.  Big hugs to all . Good night all x
Posts.Title: Obstacle course

Posts.Content: Hello Annie Like the others i am so glad you can come here and say what you need to say. I think tests and waiting for results is the worst time. Like'you I have played the awful worst case scenario in my head many times. Unlike you I have had lump removed and then chemo but the scar is lumpy and since chemo my breast seems to be sorer and twingey. I wonder whether it might be useful to speak to one of the helpline people here or on  breast cancer care or confide in your BCN if you feel comfortable with this. I have chemo next week and chemo brain allowing will ask re chemo and breast pain. I hope this is what it is.  What we realy want is to be told everything is OK and I hope your results are good. What has helped me is foot relfexology as a treat (this really helps me to relax though I know not everyone can do this or likes having their feet being touched). I have also seen there are relaxation classes near me which I am thinking may help me. However I do know some days I dont want to leave the house. Hang on in there  Lots of love Elaine xxx
Posts.Title: Feel like I am back at square one

Posts.Content: Hi I had to go to GP for a sick note not long before I got the post op results. I was a bit anxious and discussed my worries. I was always the strong one andI felt weak. He said expressing my feelingswas a good thing and in his opinion led to positive outcomes overall. This includes both the positive and the negative. I can veer between the two in any given hour of t.he day. Like the side effects etc we have many shared  /different/experiences, shared and different reactions and treatments. I have found the emotional side really challenging and know it will continue for a long time for me. Sascha, it gladdened my heart when I saw your messages here again - this site encompasses all of us in our many situations. For me it is best not to sweep things under the carpet - positive and not so positive.  x
Posts.Title: Feel like I am back at square one

Posts.Content: Thank you so much Benja. I really appreciate the offer and will personal message you just as soon as I learn how to do it!  My profession is student  money adviser - any questions re student finance please ask! x
Posts.Title: Obstacle course

Posts.Content: Hiya Just tweeted - can;t see any of our tweets on there. There are a couple advertising her 'campaign' .One tweet from a bloke saying she looks so 'hawt' has just appeared tho I sent mine before he did! Do they censor out any tweets that are less than flattering? I was polite and advised she could donate or fund raise......   Elaine x
Posts.Title: Mel B´s "campaign"

Posts.Content: Hi Janice I know the feeling.  I had a lumpectomy 4 years ago and it is still a little tender to the touch. It is also a bit lumpy at the scar site. I have had annual mammograms and the surgeon has felt it - they all say it is fine. If you are worried get it checked - have you had your mammo and 1 yr appt? I know waiting can be hell so If the appt is a while in the future you could ask to see your BCN for her to check it?    Good luck - let us know how it goes Elaine x
Posts.Title: Tenderness 1 year after lumpectomy operation

Posts.Content: Hi Benja I have everything crossed for you. I have lumps all along the lumpectomy scar and my surgeon was not concerned re these. Not all lumps are recurrence but you are doing the right thing getting it checked out.  I haven't had reconstruction but perhaps someone may reply who has had such a lump on their reconstruction dnat was OK. I hope you can see your surgeon asap as every day of worry is horrible and hope that they can re-assure you or get it checked out. Hope it is nothing to worry about X
Posts.Title: New lump!

Posts.Content: Hi Louise92 I am 5 years past diagnosis - still alive and (on a good day) kicking. Just popping in to share my experience. A few months ago I asked BCN about a sore nipple and she got me a clinic appt the next day. I have had a lump on the scar line where my lump was removed for ages and the surgeon always said - no worries. This time the BCN became worried and I had the same as you - ultrasound/biopsy. Felt  so anxious waiting yet again but now I do appreciate that it was checked out. I had a long week waiting - it is one of the worst aspects of our treatment. Luckily it was scar tissue. Just popped on to let you know that it can be nothing serious. I hope your results show it is benign. In the meantime try to do some things to distract yourself - hard I know. All the best xxx
Posts.Title: Waiting a week for results!!

Posts.Content: Hi Me I had the same and oncologist and surgeon examined me both said it was fine. The lumpy bit is still there and is still bit sore - rads finished March. Just had my first post treatment mammo and although bit painful it wasn't as bad as expecting. Will know results when see surgeon in 3 weeks. Guess Ill know for sure then but none of the professionals who saw/felt it were concerned. When I consented to rads I was told it may cause hardness. Best way to help you right now may be to contact breast care nurse or ring oncologist nurse or onc secretary and ask if they can fit you into their weekly clinic? Hopefully some reassurance from the onc will help ease your mind. Good luck X
Posts.Title: is it just the scar?

Posts.Content: Hi Lynne I finished chemo nearly 4 weeks ago and can remember feeling very nervous before the first one. As most ladies say - take the anti sickness meds. I felt less nauseous with each treatment but tiredness can  accumulate so rest when you need to. By week 2-3 after each chemo you may find you begin to feel OK again so feel more able to catch up on things you want to do before the next session. My advice would be to be kind to yourself and take it easy. Try not to worry about doing everything you are used to doing, It is time to really look after yourself.  I had some different symptoms with the first eg spots on my face. I had some mouth/nose soreness and from the 5th cycle my abdomen has been painful. Having said that as most say - it is doable though I admit that at number 3 I felt like not doing any more! There are many threads on here and on breastcancercare re. chemo and the symptoms can vary from person to person and session to session. Most symotoms have been experienced by someone and it can be re-assuring to check it out.. I did the cold cap - which was OK for the first 2 sessions as my hair was still thickish and insulated my scalp from the cap. I did keep most of my hair but it thinned quite a lot on top and did come out in clumps after number 2. As it was winter I was able to wear a wooly hat when I went out and it looked fine so I never needed the wig. The cap felt colder with each session but I perservered though was tempted to give up. They gave me hot drinks which helped as did the heated pillow they used for the arm in which  they injected the chemo. It didn't add 3-4 hours - I would say about 1.5-2 hours max. in my case. Good luck with what ever you decide. Elaine x
Posts.Title: Cold cap? any advice

Posts.Content: Hi Good news re the size of your tumour. I echo what has been said re exercises and clothes that open at the front. After my op I was lucky - my BCN brought me a vest with Velcro at the front which was sooo helpful and helped me feel secure but wasn't tight. Good luck with your op x
Posts.Title: what to wear

Posts.Content: Hi Jan Sorry to hear about the on going pain and worry. I don't know why it took nearly 4 months for you to get the help you needed. I also had an infection after my op but it was before rads. The surgeon didn't want to give antibiotics but the bcn had a swab tested (I had quite a bit of seroma after the op) and it showed infection. This was after a few weeks of complaining and hoping it would clear up. The infection delayed the healing but did get better after antibiotics. It can take a while for everything to settle down after the op. Because I had chemo it was a while before rads but I may have had swelling and redness if I had not had chemo and had rads sooner (?)   Hard to know. I was told the effects of rads carries on after the treatment so it could be hot and red for a while and coupled with the infection it may have dragged on for you?. Has it showed any signs of getting better yet? All he best x
Posts.Title: Hot & red breast

Posts.Content: Thanks Alison. It has helped. Health professionals are making judgement calls but I won't know unless I have a scan. I will discuss it and see what the GP thinks. I am not very assertive when I get in the surgery but I know I will be unhappy if I go away without further investigation. Chris - thanks for your reply - I think the scan you mentioned is a Dexa bone scan which looks at bone density but I don't think it detects secondaries? Perhaps someone could put me right if this is wrong. I have to have one of these at the start of next year.   Thanks again x
Posts.Title: Bone scan

Posts.Content: Hi All Gonna ring BCN at 9 but wondered if anyone has had same? Had lump removed nearly 3 wks ago. Had some spotting and breast felt tight and swollen. Woke this morning to find quie big leak - brownish/watery pink. Breast now more comfy bit it still leaking. Anyone had similar? Elaine x
Posts.Title: Wound leaking

Posts.Content: Hiya George and Jackie Thanks for remembering me!  And for your info and perspective. I did have the shorter dexa after finishing treatment which is where they found the thinning. I am also dropping acid every Sunday morning and on calcium. I didn't know there was a more intensive dexa. I will have a look at the link to mug up before I speak to my GP.   x
Posts.Title: Bone scan

Posts.Content: Hi Just to follow up -  I was referred for an x-ray which came back normal. I know this doesn't mean it has not spread and this does worry me at times.  I am still getting hip pain but mainly on the left where I had a previous back problem. I intend to go back to my GP at some point but for the time being need some peace from tests/waiting for results. I am 20 months past dx and still have ups and downs emotionally. I have another 4 yrs of Letrazole :(    I am gritting my teeth. Like others here have said - I now feels about 90.   My onc has referred me for acupuncture to see if that helps with pain which I also have in hands, feet and elbows. Not sure if this will help and there is a long waiting list.... x
Posts.Title: Bone scan

Posts.Content: Hiya Babs Thanks for your wishes- really so appreciated - cross everything.I know you understand this bit - every twinge and shot of fear. i manage minute to minute. I have had trouble sorting out the acronyms  but knew WLE meant lumpectomy . Just looked it up and think it stands for wide local excision. At the appt a week Mon they will tell me whether they have the margins needed (hope not to have another op) and when I can start radiotherapy. Obviously I am paranoid about it having spread. All I can do now is try to look after myself and try to think less drastic thoughts. Look after yourself Elaine xxx
Posts.Title: best onc app ever

Posts.Content: Morning, I am now 18mths past diagnosis and been on Letrazole for about 11 months. I have classic side effects - sore joints and tiredness. I also have osteo in spine and osteopenia in hips. For about 2-3 months I have had pain in the left hip and lower spine. My GP didn't think it was cancer and said to see how it went. 2 months later I am still in pain and have an appt later today. I would like some re-assurance and wondered if he would refer me for a scan. I did speak to someone on a helpline and they suggested it was probably early days in terms of any spread and that the pain was probably from the osteoporosis though they advised no-one could be sure. I don't like tests and the waiting for results but the pain does concern me. Worry doesn't help recovery. Not sure how my GP will respond but should I ask for a scan?     x
Posts.Title: Bone scan

Posts.Content: Thanks all for your help. Think I need relaxation classes.... Elaine x
Posts.Title: Wound leaking

Posts.Content: Hi   Was thinking of you today. What a great relief. So happy for you. It is hard to take it a stage at a time and you have faced it all. I have my appt in 10 days -  they did a WLE in the end yesterday and now I just need to wait it out. Grrrr   Love   Elaine xxx
Posts.Title: best onc app ever

Posts.Content: Thank you KateG. Did eventually manage to contact BCN who said could I wait until tomorrow but to come in if it got worse. It then streamed out which was bit worrying so got to hspt. with load tissue against it.  BCN  squeezed loads of bloody liquid out which eased pressure as it was tight.The consultant came to have a look. He thinks there is a new bruise - caused by doing too much?? Not sure re this one but now resting up. They put waterproof dressing on and said to come back Fri morning to get it checked. Keeping fingers crossed it will heal up and no more leaking.   Elaine x
Posts.Title: Wound leaking

Posts.Content: Hiya Good luck for today. I waited 2 weeks for my results - it really is the worst time. I was on my own and the consultant wasn't very warm but the nurses were lovely. I hope it is benign but if not please hold on to the fact that it can be highly treatable and many of us are still here years later. Let us know how you get on - will be thinking of you this afternoon Cyber hugs x
Posts.Title: Average time for results?

Posts.Content: Hi Lovely news. Thanks for sharing. Have a great Christmas X
Posts.Title: Best Christmas news!

Posts.Content: Hiya Obviously your mind won't be put at rest until you have it checked out. I recently had something similar. I have always had a lumpy scar but I noticed one round lump and BCN sent me for biopsy. One weeks wait and going in for results was scary. It put me back to how it was 5 years ago when I was originally diagnosed. My car broke down on the way to hospital - luckily I had someone with me to hold my hand and help keep my chin up. It turned out to be scar tissue so it is possible. I am crossing everything that it is the same for you. xxx
Posts.Title: Could it be another tumour?

Posts.Content: Hi We are at the same stage with this but what has really helped the pain has been acupuncture. Paracetemol helps me as and when but overall I find life more tolerable since the acupuncture.I am grateful that hormone therapy can help me but it did really get me down I still have tiredness though not the hot flushes. xxxx
Posts.Title: After Letrozole?

Posts.Content: Hello Babs Thanks for sharing this. Glad your op went well. I am going in on Weds next week for the node thing then mastectomy on the next day. I know the time between having it and seeing the surgeon will be a nervous wait so I can empathise with this one. I need to find ways to take my mind off the worries. Good luck for the 10th .Elaine x
Posts.Title: now had mastectomy and recovering

Posts.Content: Hi Hollyoskar Mine took 2 weeks which was agony so 4 weeks sounds really hard to deal with. I have been using this site for 2-3 years now and waiting for results is a common theme. The anxiety has got to be unhealthy so anything that could be done to speed it up is humane. I came across a report from the Cancer Campaign group which showed research into how integrated care for cancer patients is. They had about 19 demands and the second one (after speedy referrals for diagnosis) was the need for patients to have quicker test results. If you goggle Cancer Campaigning Group - Cancer patients experience of integrated care the report should come up as a pdf. It is supported by various groups eg Macmillan there may be a link on this site? Will have a search to see if it is here. So, this is a perennial issue and one which I am dealing with at the moment. How do we get professionals to incorporate research results into practice? From what you say it is a staffing/financial issue? Is it that training places have been cut? I'm not sure but it will certainly be a consideration for me at the ballot box. Good luck at your meeting.
Posts.Title: Time it takes for pathology report

Posts.Content: P.S Had to post previous message before \ had finished because my laptop began printing backwards(weird). Just wanted to add that the report I mention above was published in 2012 and to say I admire what you are doing even though they may say they uinderstand but there is  nothing they can do in the short term, x
Posts.Title: Time it takes for pathology report

Posts.Content: Hi Annie I hope you have or will have the onc appt soon and you can say what you need to say. I hope you can have what is needed asap and that it will help your peace of mind. Re NHS - my biggest wait was for the hspt appt because the GP thought it was a cyst whch I had before. I had biopsy 18th July, dx 25th July when I met surgeon and lump removed 9th Aug. The health care trust here has a 62 day policy from (I think) dx to treatment - but not sure if all trusts same? It was a whirlwind but I thought this treatment was fairly quick with NHS?  I think ,Annie, that  you need to be heard and for treatment you want to happen asap? Get the onc to explain why it is taking time and let them know your point of view and how urgent this is for you. I try to write down all my questions and things I want to say before I see the onc so I don't forget anything. To be fair they keep a poker face when I pul the  sheet of paper with the questions on it!  You may do this already but  it helps me especially when I feel vulnerable  Lots of love - let us know how you get on x
Posts.Title: will they be able to do surgery on a BIG lump

Posts.Content: Hi Denise Thanks for sharing. I would be interested in the cookie recipe... x
Posts.Title: A few tips from my Cancer Survivorship Course

Posts.Content: Hi Helen Thanks so much for your thoughts. The BCN didn't advise outright but she said she would play'devil's advocate' which meant she only gave arguments for the quadrectomy. She was concerned re the emotional side of things and how I would feel losing a breast. I was for an mx before I saw her because the physical health side is paramount and now not so sure. Guess she has made me think.  I need to decide before they do the SNB next Thurs so your contribution really welcome. The thing that is worrying me is whether or not it has spread and the waiting is agonising. I know this is common but I feel like I have a chest infection and can't help worrying re my sore chest/coughing.  Elaine x
Posts.Title: Quadrectomy or MX?

Posts.Content: You are right. I am hoping to feel better when decisions have been made and I can move forward. Thanks again for your help   Elaine
Posts.Title: Quadrectomy or MX?

Posts.Content: Hiya Glad the op went well. It is heartening to those of us who haven't got there yet. I think the reason the surgeon preferred Mx was because I am C cup and he advised it would be very noticeable. BCN said that if I had quadectomy at least I would retain my cleavage but to be honest that is very very least of my concerns. Thanks for sharing re your chest infection - they can hang around. Glad your scans were clear and am thinking along same lines for peace of mind   Elaine
Posts.Title: Quadrectomy or MX?

Posts.Content: Hello   I have been given option of quadrectomy or MX. The lump is about 3.5cm and will need large lumpectomy emoving quarter of breast. Surgeon said he would advise mx if it was his wife as he can do reconstruction at later date but breast care nurse cautioned against mx as lump removal less radical and will conserve nipple even though top outside quarter of breast will be removed. She said reconstruction is 10 hr op. So confused as to which option. I am more concerned re survival at this stage - both nurse and doctor said survival rates similar for both procedures. Has anyone had a quadrectomy and how was this? Above all this my main worry is that they will find out it has spread. So hard right now living with the worry of this Love Stoksie x
Posts.Title: Quadrectomy or MX?

Posts.Content: Thanks Jellytots.  I am on the look out for these products -so very useful info. and I'll follow up the makes. I came across Lavera which Lisa Eldridge uses on one of her u tube make up demos. The foundation and concealer is not as smooth to apply as it doesn'y have silicon but is does the job. Also Korres which is a Greek firm. I also bought their lip butter (various colours) online which is lovely and cost about £6. x
Posts.Title: Parabens

Posts.Content: I do empathise with you.I have done exactly the same - googling symtoms etc even though this is not always the best idea.  I had rib pain for a few months though on the side of the op. It did subside eventually - I may have lifted something and strained muscles between the ribs? I wondered whether in your case it may have something to do with sleeping more on one side than usual? I worried that every pain was cancer. Be kind to yourself and try to lessen judging yourself badly. We have been through and are still having a vulnerable time. Don't worry about your onc thinking you are a hypochondriac. I think many of us are more vigilant now. He or she may be the same if they had had the diagnosis of cancer! They may not be thinking this anyway and even if they are thinking this they should still  listen to you re any symptoms you are having. This is their job. So please let the medics know your symptoms - better than worrying on your own. Glad you only have until Thurs to do this. Hopefully the pain will pass and you can feel less anxiety. I still worry eg I have hip pain and think I will have ups and downs emotionally from now on. With every milestone (now 2 yrs post diagnosis) I am hoping this will fade a little. Enter your message... x
Posts.Title: need some advice....rib pain/niggles

Posts.Content: Hi Emma I have been here for a couple years and have followed your story. When you said you lost someone close I knew immediately it was your sheep. I am so glad your treatment is working. Will be watching on 26th. All the very best Emma- you deserve it! Elaine x
Posts.Title: Sheep and Cancer - now on TV!

Posts.Content: Hi Elaine Sorry I can't help with answers but I am interested If anyone has tried both and if there are less SE with femara. I have been on Letrozole for nearly 2 yrs. joint pain is the worst. I also have itchy eyes and dryness. I am lucky to have acupuncture via NHS clinic. This does help with joints but I am trying to live with it all. I just hope it is 5 years and not 10. Guess I will cross that bridge when it comes.  X
Posts.Title: Letrozole V Femara

Posts.Content: Hi Denise I have been on Letrozole for nearly 2 yrs and suffer from joint pain. After about 6 monhs I too developed hip pain. It is mostly in one hip. I am also taking meds for osteoporosis. My onc referred me for acupuncture aand this does help alongside paracetemol. I have good days and bad days.  I do get pangs of anxiety. I am gritting my teeth for the next 3 years but the pain does bring worry. It does make it harder to move forward. Glad your scans were clear. What scans did you have?My GP sent me for x-ray - in case there was a fracture but no scans. Can I ask if you get itchy eyes? I am not sure if this is due to drugs or something else. Hard to separate it all ! All the best x
Posts.Title: Hip pain Anastroloze ??

Posts.Content: Hi Hope 2013 is a good one for all of us. Lovely to hear how some of you have finished the gruelling bits. I have one more chemo in Jan then rads/drugs. Wonder how it will feel to be off the rollercoaster.... I am so grateful for all the help and support here over the last 6 months. Now I am trying to think of some treat for the end of chemo /rads. so great to hear plans others are making. Fancy some sun and relaxation. Happy New Year all x
Posts.Title: new year onwards and upwards

Posts.Content: Hiya Sounds great. Feel inspired. Gonna do some research for nice places to go.. Good to have something to look forward to that is a pleasure. Enjoy!   x
Posts.Title: new year onwards and upwards

Posts.Content: Hi Just to second all the above posts. Like Cupcake says - to those who find certain threads negative avoid the threads which you don't want to see. I do.  I am a big girl and can take a bit of honesty or chose  to read what  I want. I have really appreciated the posts and also the knowledge and support from Sascha Rose. I think the space will be poorer now .......please reconsider.     Elaine x
Posts.Title: Wishing everyone well and goodbye

Posts.Content: I agree with Helen that speaking to someone if you can would help - perhaps when you return or before if it is easy and you are anxious.I don't know if you are abroad but the UK number is 0808 808 0000 Mon-Fri 9am -8pm, Another useful number is Breast Cancer Care - 0800 800 6000 Mon-Fri 9am-5pm and Sat 10-2pm. Again, not sure re phoning from abroad. I have found both really useful. Hope you can enjoy the rest of your holiday and  that everything is fine All the best Elaine
Posts.Title: Inflammatory breast cancer and pregnancy

Posts.Content: Hi Louise . Just got back from hspt. Just saw BCN (onc not needed as was checking the leaking of lumpectomy wound and getting swab)- she reiterated what already been said here. I asked about lumps at the site of op scar and she re-assured that most lumps at site of op will be scar tissue and can be there for many months. Hope you will feel better when they have had a look and a feel of it. Good luck for Thurs.    Elaine x
Posts.Title: Hard lump under lumpectomy scar ?

Posts.Content: Hi Louise Agree with Mistymoley- talk to someone like the BCN. In my case, I am not at the point where I want to press too much as been leaking. Surgeon did tell me he was putting in a titanium clip (which may set off some metal detectors). I am wondering if I will be able to feel this later as a lump. I am seeing the onc tomorrow and will try to remember to ask re lumps on the scar. If I learn anything I will pass it on Elaine x

Posts.Title: Hard lump under lumpectomy scar ?

Posts.Content: Hi Sascha I wish your surgeon was a better communicator and realised how important this is - tut tut is no way to talk to a patient. On top of this he is does not appear confident in his own ability so I would ge a second opinion as he suggests. My surgeon is a plastic surgeon - could this be an option for you to find one under the health service in Spain? If I  had had a mx I was told I would have had to have waited a year after rads. Hopefully others here can give you the benefit of their experience. A year is a long time when you feel as you do but I would try for a another opinion to see if it was more optinistic and confident. x
Posts.Title: More great news.....wonderful week
